thread.section_title: Hitchweb.com Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Hitchweb.com | hitchweb.com
thread.title: Jay4Dee

author: Jay4Dee
title: Jay4Dee
text:
I bought the Drawtite hitch for my 2016 Nissan Murano rather than the Curt because it is a stronger built hitch. It was easy to install. I used a tap to clean out the existing threaded holes in the frame. Held the hitch up and installed the 4 bolts that hold it in place. I used blue medium strength Loctite and torqued bolts to the supplied spec. Watch a Youtube video if you have any problems. The Tekonsha trailer wiring adapter also installed very easily. I added an RV style 7 terminal plug, I found a convenient existing body grommet to feed the wire through. Double checked power with a test light. Awsome install. OEM cost of hitch and light connector was over $1200 if I installed, over $1600 if the Stealership did the install. Total cost from Hitchweb about $300 including getting a piece of 7 conductor wire from Princess Auto to connect between wiring adapter and 7 way plug.
Hitchweb has awesome customer service. Highly recommended.
